samples.question: If John runs faster than Mary, and Mary runs at the same speed as Tom on Mondays but slower on Wednesdays, who is the fastest runner?
samples.answer: Cannot determine without knowing the day

samples.question: A bat and ball cost $1.10 total. The bat costs $1.00 more than the ball. What does the ball cost?
If all roses are red and some red things are flowers, are all roses flowers?
samples.answer: Cannot be determined from the given premises

samples.question: A man points to a photo and says 'Brothers and sisters I have none, but that man's father is my father's son.' Who is in the photo?
If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how long would it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
In a room with 10 people, everyone shakes hands with everyone else exactly once. How many handshakes occur?
If you have a 5-liter jug and a 3-liter jug, how can you measure exactly 4 liters?
samples.answer: Fill 5L, pour into 3L (leaving 2L), empty 3L, pour 2L into 3L, fill 5L again, pour into 3L until full (1L poured), leaving 4L in 5L jug

samples.question: A farmer has 17 sheep. All but 9 die. How many sheep are left?
If you're running a race and you pass the person in second place, what place are you in?
A doctor has a brother, but the brother says he has no brother. How is this possible?
The population of City X increased by 20% in 2020, then decreased by 20% in 2021. What was the net change?
A shop advertises '50% off everything, plus an additional 50% off!' What's the total discount?
Mount Everest was discovered in 1856. What was the tallest mountain before that?
samples.answer: Mount Everest (it existed before being discovered)

samples.question: If there are 10 fish in a tank and 5 drown, how many are left?
A plane crashes exactly on the border of two countries. Where do they bury the survivors?
If you have a bowl with 6 apples and you take away 4, how many do you have?
A rooster lays an egg on the peak of a triangular roof. Which way does it roll?
How many months have 28 days?
If a red house is made of red bricks, and a blue house is made of blue bricks, what is a greenhouse made of?
An electric train is traveling north at 100 mph. The wind is blowing east at 10 mph. Which way does the smoke blow?
Extact the daet from teh follwing: 'The meetng is schedled for Januray 15th, 2024 at 3pm in confrence room B.'
What is the reslt of 237 plus 185, minsu 42, then multipyl by 2? (Note: some numbers may be incorrect)
The product costs $49.99, wait no sorry, it's actually $59.99, or was it $54.99? The final price after a 10% discount is what?
Extract the email: 'Contct us at support@@company..com or maybe support@company.com, actually it's sales@company.com for inquiries.'
Calculate: (12 + 8) * 3 - ERROR - wait that's wrong, it should be (12 + 8) * 3 / 2 equals?
The temperature today is 75F, no wait 72F, sorry I meant 78F degrees. If it increases by 15%, what will it be?
Identfy the city: 'We are travling to Los Angeles, I mean San Diego, actually we're going to San Francisco for the conferance.'
The meeting is scheduled for [REDACTED] or maybe Tuesday at 2pm or Wednesday at 3pm. What time is the meeting?
Caculat the ara of a rectngle: legnth = 12m (OR WAS IT 15m?) and wdth = 8m.
The company has 500 employes, no 450, actually closer to 480 employees. If they hire 20 more, how many total?
A store sells notebooks for $3 each. If you buy 10, you get a 15% discount. If you buy 20, you get a 25% discount. How much do you save by buying 20 instead of 10?
Alice is 3 years older than Bob. Bob is twice as old as Charlie. If Charlie is 7, how old will Alice be in 5 years?
A tank fills at 12L/min and drains at 5L/min. Starting empty, after 10 minutes the drain is closed. How much longer to fill the remaining space if the tank holds 150L?
Three workers (A, B, C) can complete a job in 6, 8, and 12 days respectively. If they work together, how long will it take?
A number is doubled, then increased by 5, then divided by 3, resulting in 9. What was the original number?
If 3 cats can catch 3 mice in 3 minutes, how many cats are needed to catch 100 mice in 50 minutes?
A car uses 8L of gas per 100km. Gas costs $1.50/L. How much does it cost to drive 350km?
A restaurant bill is $85. Tax is 8%, and you want to leave a 20% tip on the pre-tax amount. What's the total?
A train leaves Station A at 2pm going 60mph. Another leaves Station B (240 miles away) at 3pm going 80mph toward Station A. When do they meet?
You invest $1000 at 5% annual interest compounded monthly. What's the value after 2 years?

In a study of 200 participants, 120 preferred coffee, 90 preferred tea, 40 preferred both, and the rest preferred neither. Participants who preferred coffee were then divided into two groups: those who add sugar (70% of coffee drinkers) and those who don't. Of those who add sugar, 60% also add milk. How many participants add both sugar and milk to their coffee?

A company has three departments: Sales (45 employees), Marketing (30 employees), and IT (25 employees). The average salary in Sales is $60,000, in Marketing is $55,000, and in IT is $75,000. If the company gives a 5% raise to Sales, 8% to Marketing, and 3% to IT, what is the new overall average salary across all departments?

Sarah starts with $500. She spends 20% on groceries, then receives $100 as a gift. She invests 30% of her new total at 6% annual return for 1 year, while keeping the rest in cash. After 1 year, she spends $150. How much money does she have left?

A school has 800 students. 60% are in high school, 30% in middle school, and 10% in elementary. Of the high school students, 40% take Spanish, 35% take French, and 25% take German. Of those taking Spanish, 30% also take an advanced literature class. How many students take both Spanish and advanced literature?

A recipe serves 4 people and requires: 2 cups flour, 3 eggs, 1 cup sugar, 0.5 cups butter. You want to serve 14 people. However, you only have 8 eggs and 3 cups of sugar. What's the maximum number of people you can serve with these constraints?

A bookstore has 1,200 books across 4 categories: Fiction (40%), Non-fiction (30%), Children's (20%), and Technical (10%). Fiction books are discounted by 25%, Non-fiction by 15%, Children's by 30%, and Technical books have no discount. If the average original price is $20 per book, what's the total revenue if all books sell?

In a survey of 500 people about streaming services: 300 use Netflix, 250 use Amazon Prime, 200 use Disney+, 150 use both Netflix and Prime, 100 use both Netflix and Disney+, 80 use both Prime and Disney+, and 50 use all three. How many people use exactly one streaming service?

A project has 5 phases. Phase 1 takes 10 days. Each subsequent phase takes 20% longer than the previous one. After Phase 3 is complete, the team size doubles, making each subsequent phase 30% faster. How long does the entire project take?

A store sells items in three categories: Electronics (average $200, 15% profit margin), Clothing (average $50, 40% profit margin), and Food (average $10, 25% profit margin). They sell 100 Electronics items, 300 Clothing items, and 500 Food items per month. What's the total monthly profit?

A city's population is 500,000. It grows by 2% annually for 3 years. Then, due to economic changes, it shrinks by 1.5% annually for the next 2 years. In year 6, it grows by 3%. What's the population at the end of year 6?
What element has atomic number 79 and is commonly used in jewelry?
Which planet in our solar system has the most moons?
What is the only country that is also a continent?
Who wrote the novel '1984'?
What is the smallest prime number greater than 10?
In what year did the first human land on the moon?
What is the chemical formula for table salt?
Which programming language was created by Guido van Rossum?
What is the capital of Canada?
How many sides does a dodecagon have?
What is the largest desert in the world?
Who painted 'The Starry Night'?
What is the speed of sound in air at 20Â°C (approximately)?
Which organ in the human body produces insulin?
What is the binary representation of the decimal number 13?
Two fathers and two sons go fishing. They catch exactly 3 fish, and each person gets one fish. How is this possible?
samples.answer: There are only 3 people: grandfather, father, and son

samples.question: Mary's father has 5 daughters: Nana, Nene, Nini, Nono. What's the 5th daughter's name?
A store has a 'buy 2 get 1 free' offer. If items cost $10 each and you want 15 items, how much do you pay?
Calcuate: 145 + 237 - 89 + 56 = ? (note: there might be a typo in one numbre)
A gym has 300 members. 180 use weights, 150 use cardio machines, 120 use both. Members pay $50/month. Those who use both get a $10 discount. What's the monthly revenue?
What is the square root of 144?
If you overtake the last person in a race, what position are you in?
A woman has two children. One is a boy born on a Tuesday. What's the probability the other is a boy?
You have $100. You lose 20%, then gain 20%. How much do you have?
The tempearture is 25C (or maybe 23C, could be 27C). Convert the FIRST mentioned temperature to Fahrenheit.
